item.title: QuadraticKalman.jl
item.description:
QuadraticKalman.jl is a Julia package for nonlinear state estimation using quadratic approximations of the Kalman filter. It extends traditional Kalman filtering techniques to handle nonlinearity in dynamic systems, making it a powerful tool for applications in finance, engineering, and scientific computing.

Features

  • Quadratic Kalman Filtering: Implements second-order approximations for improved accuracy in nonlinear state estimation.
  • Flexible Model Specification: Supports user-defined state-space models with nonlinear dynamics.
  • Efficient Computation: Leverages Juliaâ€™s speed and automatic differentiation to compute gradients and Hessians efficiently.
  • Time-Series Applications: Suitable for filtering, smoothing, and forecasting in econometrics, engineering, and physics.
  • Modular and Extendable: Designed with flexibility in mind to allow easy adaptation to domain-specific problems.

Why QuadraticKalman.jl?

Unlike standard Extended Kalman Filters (EKF) or Unscented Kalman Filters (UKF), QuadraticKalman.jl captures higher-order dynamics without relying on sample-based approximations. This results in more accurate state estimates for highly nonlinear processes.

Use Cases

  • Financial Modeling: Estimating latent factors in asset pricing and risk modeling.
  • Engineering Systems: Sensor fusion, robotics, and control applications.
  • Climate and Environmental Science: Data assimilation for geophysical models.
  • Neuroscience & Biomedicine: Tracking hidden states in neural or physiological data.

About the Developer

QuadraticKalman.jl is developed by David Leather, a finance professor and quantitative researcher with expertise in econometrics, machine learning, and nonlinear state-space modeling.
